page.title: 18LOCAL COUNTRYSIDE
page.content: As we biked down the twisting road we glanced at the scenery.We travelled slowly to take in the view.All we could see were a few empty grassy fields and many fields of barley drifting in the wind. We got off our bikes and climbed up the steep slope of a disused railway embankment, destroying the silence with our groans.Walking among the tangled mass of brambles and brooms it was hard to believe that 20 years before trains had sped this way carrying coal from Barnsley to Hull. At one part the embankment had been nibbled away apparently by farmers eager for an easy supply of chalk suitable for mending tracks .We ran down the slope to the road, the smell of silage lost among petrol fumes. K. Watson (13)
